articles.author: Timour Azhari, Laila Bassam
articles.description: Israel bombarded the Gaza Strip and Beirut's southern suburbs on Friday, a day after U.S. envoys made a renewed but so far fruitless diplomatic push to end more than a year of fighting between Israel and Iran-backed groups Hamas and Hezbollah.
articles.title: Israel pounds Lebanon, Gaza after U.S. truce push

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said that sirens sounded in several areas of central Israel after the projectile launch.
articles.title: Rockets from Lebanon wound 11 in Israel

articles.author: James Oliphant, Nandita Bose
articles.description: Democrat Kamala Harris and Republican Donald Trump head to North Carolina on Saturday to try to clinch support in the southeastern battleground state just three days before Tuesday's U.S. presidential election.
articles.title: Trump, Harris head to North Carolina in US election campaign's final weekend

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called on Ukraine's allies to stop "watching" and take action to tackle the presence of North Korean troops in Russia before they start confronting his country in combat.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy urges allies to stop watching, start acting on North Korea

articles.author: Susana Vera
articles.description: An arts and science centre which normally plays host to opera performances was on Saturday transformed into the nerve centre for the clean-up operation after catastrophic floods in eastern Spain which have claimed at least 207 lives.
articles.title: Thousands join effort to clean up catastrophic Spanish floods

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Countries at the U.N. COP16 summit on nature in Cali, Colombia, on Friday approved a measure to create a permanent body for Indigenous peoples to consult on United Nations decisions on nature conservation.
articles.title: UN COP16 nature summit creates permanent body for Indigenous peoples

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Serbia wound up a rescue operation and opened an investigation on Saturday into a roof collapse that killed 14 and injured three at a railway station in the northern city of Novi Sad.
articles.title: Serbia opens probe into railway building disaster that killed 14

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Gram Slattery
articles.description: Democrats are readying a rapid-fire response to flood social media and the airwaves with calls for calm and patience with vote-counting should Donald Trump try to prematurely claim election victory, as he did in 2020, Harris campaign and party officials told Reuters.
articles.title: Democrats have a plan if Trump prematurely declares election victory

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Saturday promised reforms to speed up the economy and overhaul the public sector after the first budget of his new government failed to boost the growth outlook and sent government bond prices into a two-day dive.
articles.title: UK's Starmer pledges more growth reforms after budget hit to markets

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least two people were wounded in an overnight Russian drone strike on the Ukrainian capital Kyiv, city officials said on Saturday.
articles.title: Two injured in Russian drone attack on Kyiv
